required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of a 1-Millimeter Resolution Clinical Positron Emission Tomography (PET) System in Head and Neck Cancer Imaging
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study of a 1-Millimeter Resolution Clinical PET System in Head and Neck Cancer Imaging

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to gain initial experience imaging HNC patient using a new PET camera, a 1mm spacial resolution. The goal is to understand image quality of the system and to see how it works in a clinical environment.

detailed_description.textblock:
PRIMARY OBJECTIVE(S): Gain initial experience imaging head/neck cancer patients using a novel PET camera comprising two opposing panels with 1 millimeter spatial resolution.
SECONDARY OBJECTIVE(S):
1. Determine the radioactive dose and scan time required for this novel 1 millimeter (mm) resolution clinical PET camera.
2. Images obtained with the 1 mm resolution PET camera will be compared to conventional PET imaging (which will serve as gold standard) for image quality and lesion/node visualization.

primary_outcome.measure: Acquiring PET images of HNC patients with the 1 mm resolution PET imaging device.
primary_outcome.description: PET images of HNC patients with the 1 mm resolution PET imaging device will be qualitatively accessed whether the camera can visualize the primary lesion, including heterogeneity and lymph nodes will be assessed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Measure image quality of the 1 mm resolution PET imaging device
secondary_outcome.description: Image quality of the 1 mm resolution PET imaging device (scale 1-5) with 5 being highest 'image quality' will be assessed to understand radioactive dose and scan time required for a given desired image quality.

arm_group.description: Patients already undergoing a PET/CT scan for HNC will afterwards undergo a PET scan with the proposed device, thus no additional radioactivity is needed as part of this study.

intervention.description: 1-Millimeter Resolution Clinical PET System in Head and Neck Cancer (HNC) Imaging

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Biopsy-confirmed diagnosis of HNC
2. Patient scheduled to undergo surgery for HNC
3. Scheduled to have a PET/CT study on a conventional PET/CT system
4. Age greater than or equal to 19 years of age.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Additional condition, or extenuating circumstance that, in the opinion of the investigator, may interfere with study compliance.
